sap.ca.ui.charts.CombinedChart.description: Allows you to create a chart using vertical bars and lines to represent the data
sap.ca.ui.charts.CombinedChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/CombinedChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : any
    • {@link #getPrimaryAxis primaryAxis} : any
    • {@link #getSecondAxis secondAxis} : any
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getScrollArea scrollArea} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.CombinedChart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Allows you to create a chart using vertical bars and lines to represent the data

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart.description: Chart implementation on top of sap.viz that takes care of common functionality. - Embedding in a scroll container - Common color palette - Minimum bar / dot / blip ... size - Integration with ChartToolbar and ChartPopover
sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/Chart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getDataset dataset} : object
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: Bar)
    • {@link #getMinShapeSize minShapeSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 48px)
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getSecondAxisVisible secondAxisVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLegend showLegend} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartSelectionMode (default: Multiple)
    • {@link #getShowHoverBackground showHoverBackground} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTooltip showTooltip} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowPopover showPopover} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowDataLabel showDataLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getYAxisLabelFormatter yAxisLabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getYAxis2LabelFormatter yAxis2LabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getXAxisLabelFormatter xAxisLabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getXAxis2LabelFormatter xAxis2LabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getPlotAreaAxisTooltipFormatter plotAreaAxisTooltipFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getTooltipFormatter tooltipFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormatter dataLabelFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getPopoverFormatter popoverFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getPopoverGroupFormatter popoverGroupFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getChartSemanticColorFormatter chartSemanticColorFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getInternalVizChart internalVizChart} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getChartPopOver chartPopOver} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getPopoverSubHeader popoverSubHeader} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getPopoverFooter popoverFooter} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getAdvancedChartSettings advancedChartSettings} : object
    • {@link #getStackedChartWidthEnhancer stackedChartWidthEnhancer} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getNoData noData} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectDataPoint selectDataPoint} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:popoverBeforeOpen popoverBeforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:popoverAfterOpen popoverAfterOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Chart implementation on top of sap.viz that takes care of common functionality. - Embedding in a scroll container - Common color palette - Minimum bar / dot / blip ... size - Integration with ChartToolbar and ChartPopover

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. sap.ca.ui.Hierarchy.description: Display the Hierarchy of an item. Useful to indicates where an object stand in a chain of hierarchical data. The emphasized item shows the one item to display. Optional item can be hidden using the hideOptionalLevels property. Hidden items will stay accessible with an expand button.
sap.ca.ui.Hierarchy.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Hierarchy. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHideOptionalLevels hideOptionalLevels} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ca.ui.HierarchyItem[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.Hierarchy.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
Display the Hierarchy of an item. Useful to indicates where an object stand in a chain of hierarchical data. The emphasized item shows the one item to display. Optional item can be hidden using the hideOptionalLevels property. Hidden items will stay accessible with an expand button.

DeprecatedInfo.description: This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem.description: Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control
sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new PictureViewerItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSrc src} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getImage image} : sap.m.Image
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureViewerItem is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control

sap.ca.ui.PictureItem.description: A picture / photo Item for AddPicture and PictureViewer Controls
sap.ca.ui.PictureItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new PictureItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStatus status} : string
    • {@link #getSource source} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 62px)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 62px)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:loaded loaded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.PictureItem.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 This control has been made available in sap.m. Please use the sap.m.Carousel instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
A picture / photo Item for AddPicture and PictureViewer Controls

sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext.description:
This control allows you to open a dialog containing a list of customers for users to pick. The chosen selected customer is persisted using sap.ushell services that shall be fully configured outside of this control.

The dialog can be open following two modes: "select" : exiting without choosing a customer is firing the customerSelected event with a null customer before closing the dialog "change" : exiting without choosing a customer is simply closing the dialog

When opening the dialog in "select" mode, if a customer has been persisted in a previous session, it will be retrieved and the dialog won't open at all.
sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CustomerContext. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPersonalizationPageName personalizationPageName} : string (default: AppCustomerContext)
    • {@link #getShowSalesArea showSalesArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPath path} : string (default: /Customers)
    • {@link #getCustomerIDProperty customerIDProperty} : string (default: CustomerID)
    • {@link #getCustomerNameProperty customerNameProperty} : string (default: CustomerName)
    • {@link #getSalesOrganizationNameProperty salesOrganizationNameProperty} : string (default: SalesOrganizationName)
    • {@link #getDistributionChannelNameProperty distributionChannelNameProperty} : string (default: DistributionChannelName)
    • {@link #getDivisionNameProperty divisionNameProperty} : string (default: DivisionName)
    • {@link #getDialogTitle dialogTitle} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:customerSelected customerSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. Please use Contextual Filter design instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
This control allows you to open a dialog containing a list of customers for users to pick. The chosen selected customer is persisted using sap.ushell services that shall be fully configured outside of this control. The dialog can be open following two modes: "select" : exiting without choosing a customer is firing the customerSelected event with a null customer before closing the dialog "change" : exiting without choosing a customer is simply closing the dialog When opening the dialog in "select" mode, if a customer has been persisted in a previous session, it will be retrieved and the dialog won't open at all.

Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and VizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. undefined

sap.ca.ui.ZoomableScrollContainer.description: Based on a ScrollContainer, it allows you to pinch and zoom on mobile devices
sap.ca.ui.ZoomableScrollContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ZoomableScrollContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getZoomable zoomable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getInitialScale initialScale} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getMinScale minScale} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getMaxScale maxScale} : float (default: 4)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ScrollContainer#constructor sap.m.ScrollContainer} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.ZoomableScrollContainer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 ZoomableScrollContainer is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Based on a ScrollContainer, it allows you to pinch and zoom on mobile devices

vertical.description:
Whether vertical scrolling should be possible.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true". Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

height.description:
The height of the ScrollContainer. By default the height equals the content height. If only horizontal scrolling is used, do not set the height or make sure the height is always larger than the height of the content.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.
height.helpDescription:
The height of the ScrollContainer. By default the height equals the content height. If only horizontal scrolling is used, do not set the height or make sure the height is always larger than the height of the content.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile.description: Display aTile that presents an overview of a customer
sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverviewTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: null)
    • {@link #getContact contact} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getAddress address} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getOpportunities opportunities} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getRating rating} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getLastContact lastContact} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getNextContact nextContact} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getRevenue revenue} : string (default: null)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getContactActive contactActive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contactPress contactPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Tile#constructor sap.m.Tile} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
Display aTile that presents an overview of a customer

highlight.description: Defines the highlight state of the list items. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedVerticalColumnCh.description: Stacked Vertical Column Chart wrapper around the viz StackedColumnChart / MultipleStackedColumnChart. To be used in conjunction with the chart toolbar.
sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedVerticalColumnCh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/StackedVerticalColumnChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: StackedColumn)
    • {@link #getMinTouchSize minTouchSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 48px)
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any (default: [["##"]])
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedVerticalColumnCh.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Stacked Vertical Column Chart wrapper around the viz StackedColumnChart / MultipleStackedColumnChart. To be used in conjunction with the chart toolbar.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

tileContent.helpDescription: Reference to one PictureViewerItem coming from the PictureViewer.

sap.ca.ui.PictureTile.description: Tile control embedding an image and allowing custom sizing
sap.ca.ui.PictureTile.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new PictureTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 32px)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 32px)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getTileContent tileContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDelete pictureDelete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.CustomTile#constructor sap.m.CustomTile} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.PictureTile.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Tile control embedding an image and allowing custom sizing

DeprecatedInfo.description: PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.charts.LineChart.description: Line Chart for the Fiori Project
sap.ca.ui.charts.LineChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/LineChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : string (default: Line Chart)
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any (default: #0)
    • {@link #getMinTouchSize minTouchSize} : string (default: 48px)
    • {@link #getMinTouchWidth minTouchWidth} : string (default: 48px)
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowScrollContext showScrollContext} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartDataset chartDataset} : any
    • {@link #getDatasetSettings datasetSettings} : any
    • {@link #getChartDatasetSettings chartDatasetSettings} : any
    • {@link #getDataPath dataPath} : string
    • {@link #getData data} : any
    • {@link #getChartBusinessData chartBusinessData} : any
    • {@link #getUseDelayedResize useDelayedResize} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getVertical vertical} : sap.m.VBox
  • Events
    • {@link #event:onDetailsSelected onDetailsSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.LineChart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Line Chart for the Fiori Project

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.ExpansibleFeedListItem.description: Extends the FeedListItem to hide text when it is longer than maxLines. When text is hidden a See more link is displayed, clicking on the link displays the entire text.
sap.ca.ui.ExpansibleFeedListItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExpansibleFeedListItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMaxLines maxLines} : int (default: 5)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.FeedListItem#constructor sap.m.FeedListItem} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.ExpansibleFeedListItem.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 This control has been made available in sap.m. Please use sap.m.FeedListItem instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
Extends the FeedListItem to hide text when it is longer than maxLines. When text is hidden a See more link is displayed, clicking on the link displays the entire text.

DeprecatedInfo.description: This control has been made available in sap.m. Please use sap.m.FeedListItem instead! This control will not be supported anymore.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

icon.description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the FeedListItem. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font. If no icon is provided, a default person-placeholder icon is displayed. Icon is only shown if showIcon = true.
icon.helpDescription: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the FeedListItem. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font. If no icon is provided, a default person-placeholder icon is displayed. Icon is only shown if showIcon = true.

highlightText.description: Defines the semantics of the {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlight highlight} property for accessibility purposes.

activeIcon.description: Icon displayed when the list item is active.
activeIcon.helpDescription: Icon displayed when the list item is active.

highlight.description: Defines the highlight state of the list items. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.
highlight.helpDescription: Defines the highlight state of the list items. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

moreLabel.description:
Customizable text for the "MORE" link at the end of the feed list item.
When the maximum number of characters defined by the maxCharacters property is exceeded and the text of the feed list item is collapsed, the "MORE" link can be used to expand the feed list item and show the rest of the text.

Options are the standard values for the target attribute of the HTML anchor tag: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search.

maxCharacters.description: The expand and collapse feature is set by default and uses 300 characters on mobile devices and 500 characters on desktops as limits. Based on these values, the text of the FeedListItem is collapsed once text reaches these limits. In this case, only the specified number of characters is displayed. By clicking on the text link More, the entire text can be displayed. The text link Less collapses the text. The application is able to set the value to its needs.
maxCharacters.helpDescription: The expand and collapse feature is set by default and uses 300 characters on mobile devices and 500 characters on desktops as limits. Based on these values, the text of the FeedListItem is collapsed once text reaches these limits. In this case, only the specified number of characters is displayed. By clicking on the text link More, the entire text can be displayed. The text link Less collapses the text. The application is able to set the value to its needs.

maxLines.description: The maximum number of lines to display before adding the "See more" link.

iconDensityAware.description:

If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false.

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ca.ui.OverflowContainer.description: The OverflowContainer allows the content of a control to be partially displayed before being fully expanded. It will cut its content to a fixed height that can be defined. It is fully suitable within an IconTabBar.
sap.ca.ui.OverflowContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverflowContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOverflowHeight overflowHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 200px)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.OverflowContainer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.1 OverflowContainer is deprecated as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
The OverflowContainer allows the content of a control to be partially displayed before being fully expanded. It will cut its content to a fixed height that can be defined. It is fully suitable within an IconTabBar.

DeprecatedInfo.description: OverflowContainer is deprecated as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.InPlaceEdit.description: This control is used to switch between readonly and edit modes. A typical use case would be to change the value of a Label.
sap.ca.ui.InPlaceEdit.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new InPlaceEdit. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getUndoEnabled undoEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.InPlaceEdit.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. Please use sap.m.Input instead! This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.AddPicture.description: Enables users to add pictures into a form. Contains PictureItem controls that describe the media. It is designed to be used simultaneously with the PictureViewer control
sap.ca.ui.AddPicture.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AddPicture. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getButtonPageType buttonPageType} : string (default: Tab)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMaxPictureNumber maxPictureNumber} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getPictureAlign pictureAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Left)
    • {@link #getItemSize itemSize} : int (default: 64)
    • {@link #getCompression compression} : string (default: low)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPictures pictures} : sap.ca.ui.PictureItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:show show} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pictureAdded pictureAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:maxPictureLimitReached maxPictureLimitReached} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:imageUploadFailed imageUploadFailed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileNotSupported fileNotSupported} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.AddPicture.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.26 As per central UX requirements, this control is replaced by sap.m.UploadCollection. Please use the new control if you start developing an application instead of using this AddPicture control.
Enables users to add pictures into a form. Contains PictureItem controls that describe the media. It is designed to be used simultaneously with the PictureViewer control

DeprecatedInfo.description: As per central UX requirements, this control is replaced by sap.m.UploadCollection. Please use the new control if you start developing an application instead of using this AddPicture control.

    • {@link #getCustomerID customerID} : string (default: CustomerID)
    • {@link #getCustomerName customerName} : string (default: CustomerName)
    • {@link #getSalesOrganizationName salesOrganizationName} : string (default: SalesOrganizationName)
    • {@link #getDistributionChannelName distributionChannelName} : string (default: DistributionChannelName)
    • {@link #getDivisionName divisionName} : string (default: DivisionName)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.CustomListItem#constructor sap.m.CustomListItem} can be used as well.

highlight.description: Defines the highlight state of the list items. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

initialFocus.description: In the Dialog focus is set first on the leftButton and then on rightButton, when available. If another control needs to get the focus, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the On-Screen keyboard on mobile device as, due to browser limitation, the On-Screen keyboard can't be opened with JavaScript code. The opening of On-Screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.

leftButton.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the Left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting leftButton will also set the beginButton internally.
leftButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.

rightButton.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the Right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting rightButton will also set the endButton internally.

sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog.description: Select an item in a dialog from a hierarchical list
sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new HierarchicalSelectDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialogItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Dialog#constructor sap.m.Dialog} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.1 HierarchicalSelectDialog is deprecated as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
Select an item in a dialog from a hierarchical list

buttons.description: Buttons can be added to the footer area of the Dialog through this aggregation. When this aggregation is set, any change to the beginButton and endButton has no effect anymore. Buttons which are inside this aggregation are aligned at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer instead of in the middle of the footer.

beginButton.description: The button which is rendered to the left side (right side in RTL mode) of the endButton in the footer area inside the Dialog. As of version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation buttons created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of the Dialog. If the new buttons aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. When running on a phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. When running on other platforms, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.

horizontalScrolling.description: Indicates if the user can scroll horizontally inside the Dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. The Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as a direct child added to the Dialog. If there is, the Dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false, automatically ignoring the existing value of the property.

escapeHandler.description:
This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function, you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behavior which will be executed when the Escape key is pressed. By default, when the Escape key is pressed, the Dialog is immediately closed.

This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function, you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behavior which will be executed when the Escape key is pressed. By default, when the Escape key is pressed, the Dialog is immediately closed.

icon.description: Icon displayed in the Dialog header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it is density-aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.
icon.helpDescription: Icon displayed in the Dialog header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it is density-aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.

title.helpDescription: Title text appears in the Dialog header.

type.description: The type of the Dialog. In some themes, the type Message will limit the Dialog width within 480px on tablet and desktop.
type.helpDescription: The type of the Dialog. In some themes, the type Message will limit the Dialog width within 480px on tablet and desktop.

stretch.description: Determines if the Dialog will be stretched to full screen on mobile. On desktop, the Dialog will be stretched to 93% of the viewport. This property is only applicable to a Standard Dialog. Message-type Dialog ignores it.
stretch.helpDescription: Determines if the Dialog will be stretched to full screen on mobile. On desktop, the Dialog will be stretched to 93% of the viewport. This property is only applicable to a Standard Dialog. Message-type Dialog ignores it.

contentWidth.description: Preferred width of the content in the Dialog. This property affects the width of the Dialog on a phone in landscape mode, a tablet or a desktop, because the Dialog has a fixed width on a phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of the Dialog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of the Dialog width on tablet is 400px.
contentWidth.helpDescription: Preferred width of the content in the Dialog. This property affects the width of the Dialog on a phone in landscape mode, a tablet or a desktop, because the Dialog has a fixed width on a phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of the Dialog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of the Dialog width on tablet is 400px.

verticalScrolling.description: Indicates if the user can scroll vertically inside the Dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. The Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as a direct child added to the Dialog. If there is, the Dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false, automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

sap.ca.ui.charts.BubbleChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/BubbleChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any
    • {@link #getShowTitle showTitle} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowXAxisLabel showXAxisLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getXAxisFixedRange xAxisFixedRange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getXAxisMinValue xAxisMinValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getXAxisMaxValue xAxisMaxValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowYAxisLabel showYAxisLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getYAxisFixedRange yAxisFixedRange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getYAxisMinValue yAxisMinValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getYAxisMaxValue yAxisMaxValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinimumLabelSize minimumLabelSize} : int (default: 60)
    • {@link #getShowSizeLegend showSizeLegend} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getXAxisTitle xAxisTitle} : string
    • {@link #getYAxisTitle yAxisTitle} : string
    • {@link #getShowCustomLabels showCustomLabels} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getLabelProperty labelProperty} : object
    • {@link #getXAxisFormatFunction xAxisFormatFunction} : object
    • {@link #getXAxisFormatString xAxisFormatString} : string
    • {@link #getYAxisFormatFunction yAxisFormatFunction} : object
    • {@link #getYAxisFormatString yAxisFormatString} : string
    • {@link #getAxisTooltipFormatString axisTooltipFormatString} : any
    • {@link #getAxisFormatFunction axisFormatFunction} : object
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.BubbleChart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Bubble chart.

sap.ca.ui.GrowingTileContainer.description: A Tile container for the Overview tile with growing capabilities
sap.ca.ui.GrowingTileContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new GrowingTileContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getGrowing growing} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} : int (default: 20)
    • {@link #getGrowingScrollToLoad growingScrollToLoad} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ScrollContainer#constructor sap.m.ScrollContainer} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.GrowingTileContainer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

vertical.description:
Whether vertical scrolling should be possible.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true". Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.
vertical.helpDescription:
Whether vertical scrolling should be possible.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true". Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

focusable.description:
Whether the scroll container can be focused.

Note that it should be set to "true" when there are no focusable elements inside or when keyboard interaction requires an additional tab stop on the container.

See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

width.description: The width of the ScrollContainer. If not set, it consumes the complete available width, behaving like normal HTML block elements. If only vertical scrolling is enabled, make sure the content always fits or wraps.
width.helpDescription: The width of the ScrollContainer. If not set, it consumes the complete available width, behaving like normal HTML block elements. If only vertical scrolling is enabled, make sure the content always fits or wraps.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

height.description:
The height of the ScrollContainer. By default the height equals the content height. If only horizontal scrolling is used, do not set the height or make sure the height is always larger than the height of the content.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartToolBar.description: ToolBar used for displaying one chart amongst several and provide additional features: - 2 select boxes for selecting dimensions - fullscreen toggle - personalization icon - showLegend toggle
sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartToolBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/ChartToolBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowPersonalization showPersonalization} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFullScreen showFullScreen} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFullScreen fullScreen} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowLegend showLegend} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getFirstDimensionPath firstDimensionPath} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getFirstDimensionKeyPath firstDimensionKeyPath} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getFirstDimensionTextPath firstDimensionTextPath} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getSecondDimensionPath secondDimensionPath} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getSecondDimensionKeyPath secondDimensionKeyPath} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getSecondDimensionTextPath secondDimensionTextPath} : string (default: )
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCharts charts} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getToolBar toolBar} : sap.m.Bar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedChart selectedChart} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getFirstDimensionSelect firstDimensionSelect} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Select)
    • {@link #getSecondDimensionSelect secondDimensionSelect} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Select)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:personalizationPressed personalizationPressed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:firstDimensionKeySelected firstDimensionKeySelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:secondDimensionKeySelected secondDimensionKeySelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartToolBar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts and the ChartToolBar have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
ToolBar used for displaying one chart amongst several and provide additional features: - 2 select boxes for selecting dimensions - fullscreen toggle - personalization icon - showLegend toggle

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts and the ChartToolBar have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.FileUpload.description: Allows you to display a list of uploaded files. You can also upload a new one, rename or delete them
sap.ca.ui.FileUpload.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FileUpload. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl} : string
    • {@link #getFileName fileName} : string
    • {@link #getSize size} : string
    • {@link #getUrl url} : string
    • {@link #getUploadedDate uploadedDate} : string
    • {@link #getContributor contributor} : string
    • {@link #getFileExtension fileExtension} : string
    • {@link #getMimeType mimeType} : string
    • {@link #getItems items} : string
    • {@link #getUploadEnabled uploadEnabled} : boolean
    • {@link #getFileId fileId} : string
    • {@link #getXsrfToken xsrfToken} : string
    • {@link #getUseMultipart useMultipart} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAcceptRequestHeader acceptRequestHeader} : string (default: application/json)
    • {@link #getEncodeUrl encodeUrl} : string
    • {@link #getRenameEnabled renameEnabled} : boolean
    • {@link #getDeleteEnabled deleteEnabled} : boolean
    • {@link #getMultipleSelectionEnabled multipleSelectionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowNoData showNoData} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSequentialUploadsEnabled sequentialUploadsEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowAttachmentsLabel showAttachmentsLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseEditControls useEditControls} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowAttachmentsLabelInEditMode showAttachmentsLabelInEditMode} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditMode editMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getUploadProgressLabel uploadProgressLabel} : sap.m.Label
    • {@link #getAttachmentNumberLabel attachmentNumberLabel} : sap.m.Label
    • {@link #getToolBar toolBar} : sap.m.Toolbar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:deleteFile deleteFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:renameFile renameFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadFile uploadFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileUploadFailed fileUploadFailed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeUploadFile beforeUploadFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:saveClicked saveClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancelClicked cancelClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.FileUpload.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.26 This control is available in sap.m in 1.26, as sap.m.UploadCollection. Please use UploadCollection, as sap.ca.ui.FileUpload will not be supported anymore from 1.26.
Allows you to display a list of uploaded files. You can also upload a new one, rename or delete them

DeprecatedInfo.description: This control is available in sap.m in 1.26, as sap.m.UploadCollection. Please use UploadCollection, as sap.ca.ui.FileUpload will not be supported anymore from 1.26.

sap.ca.ui.model.format.DateFormat.description:
The DateFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing date and time values according to a set of format options. It uses sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat to format and parse dates, and adds a new style daysAgo for Date instances. With this style:
  • For today: "Today" will be displayed (localized)
  • For yesterday: "1 day ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • Between 2 days and 6 days in the past: "x days ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • In the future or more than 6 days in the past: the date will be formatted with a medium style
The daysAgo style can be formatted in UTC. Supported format options are pattern based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.
sap.ca.ui.model.format.DateFormat.constructorDescription: Constructor for DateFormat - must not be used: To get a DateFormat instance, please use getInstance, getDateTimeInstance or getTimeInstance.
sap.ca.ui.model.format.DateFormat.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.28 This control has been made available in sap.ui.core. Please use {@link sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat} instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
The DateFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing date and time values according to a set of format options. It uses sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat to format and parse dates, and adds a new style daysAgo for Date instances. With this style:
  • For today: "Today" will be displayed (localized)
  • For yesterday: "1 day ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • Between 2 days and 6 days in the past: "x days ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • In the future or more than 6 days in the past: the date will be formatted with a medium style
The daysAgo style can be formatted in UTC. Supported format options are pattern based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.

sap.ca.ui.DatePicker.description: Allows end users to interact with dates. Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad.
sap.ca.ui.DatePicker.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DatePicker. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFirstDayOffset firstDayOffset} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getDateValue dateValue} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.InputBase#constructor sap.m.InputBase} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.DatePicker.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 This control has been made available in sap.m. Please use the sap.m.DatePicker instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
Allows end users to interact with dates. Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad.

sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer.description: Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control
sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new PictureViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTileScaling tileScaling} : float (default: 0.95)
    • {@link #getRemovable removable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pictureDeleted pictureDeleted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.TileContainer#constructor sap.m.TileContainer} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.charts.HorizontalBarChart.description: Allows you to create a chart using horizontal bars to represent the data
sap.ca.ui.charts.HorizontalBarChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/HorizontalBarChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : object
    • {@link #getContainer container} : string (default: chart)
    • {@link #getBarHeight barHeight} : int (default: 48)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getScroll scroll} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
    • {@link #getHorizontalBarChart horizontalBarChart} : sap.viz.ui5.Bar
    • {@link #getVerticalArea verticalArea} : sap.m.VBox
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.HorizontalBarChart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Allows you to create a chart using horizontal bars to represent the data

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. sap.ca.ui.message.name: sap.ca.ui.message
sap.ca.ui.message.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.28 this control is deprecated as per central UX requirements. Please use {@link sap.m.MessageBox} instead.
Provides methods to show messages with type of Success, Error, Warning and Information in a Fiori style. sap.ca.ui.message is a static class, the statement jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.message.message") needs to be called before the function can be used. Example: 
   jQuery.sap.require("sap.ca.ui.message.message");
   
   // provide your callback function, if you want to get informed after the user closes the MessageBox
   var bIsMsgBoxClosed = false;
   var fnClose = function(){
       bIsMsgBoxClosed = true;
   };
   
   // show the erorr message in a MessageBox
   sap.ca.ui.message.showMessageBox({
       type: sap.ca.ui.message.Type.ERROR,
       message: "No connection can be established to the backend system ABC",
       details: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, eum an vidit ..."
   }, fnClose);

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

sap.ca.ui.Notes.description: This control is a List with the ability to render an additional control on top of it to add new notes. The developer is responsible to give the correct template to use to display notes (recommended are either the FeedListItem or the ExpansibleFeedListItem). The developer is also responsible to implement the code to send the notes to the backend system, by responding to the addNote event.
sap.ca.ui.Notes.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Notes. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowNoteInput showNoteInput} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTextMaxLength textMaxLength} : int (default: 1000)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:addNote addNote} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.List#constructor sap.m.List} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.Notes.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 This control has been made available in sap.m. Please use sap.m.FeedInput with sap.m.FeedListItem instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
This control is a List with the ability to render an additional control on top of it to add new notes. The developer is responsible to give the correct template to use to display notes (recommended are either the FeedListItem or the ExpansibleFeedListItem). The developer is also responsible to implement the code to send the notes to the backend system, by responding to the addNote event.

sticky.description:
Defines the section of the control that remains fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the control is in the viewport. Note: Enabling sticky column headers in List controls will not have any effect. There is limited browser support. Browsers that do not support this feature are listed below:
  • IE
  • Edge lower than version 41 (EdgeHTML 16)
  • Firefox lower than version 59
There are also some known limitations. A few are given below:
  • If the control is placed in layout containers that have the overflow: hidden or overflow: auto style definition, this can prevent the sticky elements of the control from becoming fixed at the top of the viewport.
  • If sticky column headers are enabled in the sap.m.Table control, setting focus on the column headers will let the table scroll to the top.
  • A transparent toolbar design is not supported for sticky bars. The toolbar will automatically get an intransparent background color.
  • This feature supports only the default height of the toolbar control.
sticky.helpDescription:
Defines the section of the control that remains fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the control is in the viewport. Note: Enabling sticky column headers in List controls will not have any effect. There is limited browser support. Browsers that do not support this feature are listed below:
  • IE
  • Edge lower than version 41 (EdgeHTML 16)
  • Firefox lower than version 59
There are also some known limitations. A few are given below:
  • If the control is placed in layout containers that have the overflow: hidden or overflow: auto style definition, this can prevent the sticky elements of the control from becoming fixed at the top of the viewport.
  • If sticky column headers are enabled in the sap.m.Table control, setting focus on the column headers will let the table scroll to the top.
  • A transparent toolbar design is not supported for sticky bars. The toolbar will automatically get an intransparent background color.
  • This feature supports only the default height of the toolbar control.

Constructor for a new HierarchicalSelectDialogItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

sap.ca.ui.charts.VerticalBarChart.description: Allows you to create a chart using vertical bars to represent the data
sap.ca.ui.charts.VerticalBarChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/VerticalBarChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : object
    • {@link #getContainer container} : string (default: chart)
    • {@link #getBarWidth barWidth} : int (default: 48)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getScroll scroll} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
    • {@link #getVerticalBarChart verticalBarChart} : sap.viz.ui5.Column
    • {@link #getVerticalArea verticalArea} : sap.m.VBox
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.charts.VerticalBarChart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Allows you to create a chart using vertical bars to represent the data

DeprecatedInfo.description: Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedHorizontalBarCha.description: Stacked Horizontal Bar Chart wrapper around the viz StackedBarChart / MultipleStackedBarChart. To be used in conjunction with the chart toolbar.
sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedHorizontalBarCha.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/StackedHorizontalBarChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: StackedBar)
    • {@link #getMinTouchSize minTouchSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 48px)
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any (default: [["##"]])
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.HierarchyItem.description: Item that represent a line of the Hierarchy control. The emphasized property should apply to the item that we want to represent in his hierarchy. Optionals item will be hidden if the option is true on the Hierarchy control.
sap.ca.ui.HierarchyItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new HierarchyItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getLevelType levelType} : string
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getIdentifier identifier} : string
    • {@link #getLink link} : string
    • {@link #getEmphasized emphasized} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOptional optional} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:linkPress linkPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ca.ui.HierarchyItem.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 This control is deprecated as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
Item that represent a line of the Hierarchy control. The emphasized property should apply to the item that we want to represent in his hierarchy. Optionals item will be hidden if the option is true on the Hierarchy control.

sap.ca.ui.model.format.FileSizeFormat.description:
The FileSizeFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing file size values according to a set of format options.

Simplified logic: display in kB for 1e3 <= bytes < 1e6 display in MB for 1e6 <= bytes < 1e9 ...
